metadata.value:
Job Title Technical Consultant - Storage
Reporting To Head of Global Delivery, ANZ
Direct Reports N/A
Job Purpose
The role of the Managed Services (MS) Technical Consultant – Storage resides in the functional area of Postsales
services as part of our highly experienced Managed Service team. Specifically, the role provides technical
and operational support services across the client’s enterprise storage and backup technologies. These
platforms include Hitachi Vantara hardware and software products across block, object and file storage
platforms, as well as 3rd Party products such as VMware, CommVault, and Compute solutions. This is delivered
primarily from the customer site and various locations as required. The role at times is required to be involved
in other non-operational tasks such as presales and project tasks; including but not limited to pre-requisite
checklists, initial installation, troubleshooting, implementation, customization, integration and “hands on”
training of systems and staff that support Hitachi Vantara Customers.
The Technical Consultant -Storage works closely with Project Management, Principal Consultants, Service
Delivery Managers and other MS Technical Consultants and the customer to ensure a smooth implementation
and transition from project kick-off through integration/testing/production mode to project close and then
ongoing operations and support.
For this position at Hitachi Vantara, solid knowledge of storage administration is required to succeed. You will
administer, configure, and deploy effective storage solutions. You must be able to support and troubleshoot
problems in a complex storage environment. Zoning and partitioning skills and knowledge in data migration
technologies is desirable, as is knowledge of VMware virtualisation.
Responsibilities
• Management and administration of Hitachi Vantara hardware and software storage platforms across
block, object and file
• Administration of fabric hardware and software for Cisco, Brocade and/or other fabric architectures
• Administration of Commvault backup platforms
• Interpret storage protocols including iSCSI, Fiber Channel, CIFS, NFS, NDMP protocols and hardware,
which use these products
• Maintain current knowledge of storage-related trends and issues including current emerging
technologies and best practices
• Provide capacity planning, performance analysis, develop disaster recovery plans, lead efforts towards
storage consolidation and identify storage growth, manage configurations of storage media and
storage management software
• Provide technical expertise for the development and maintenance of the storage roadmap that maps
the current and planned technical storage solutions to the Customer's business needs and objectives
• Perform storage provisioning and administration in line with policies and procedures to ensure
consistent achievement of uptime, regulatory compliance and data protection goals
• Willingness to manage a 24x7x365 storage, compute and backup environment including on-call
rotation, weekend work, etc
• Supporting Hitachi Vantara storage platforms in a VMware virtualization environment
• Manage and provide current storage usage statistics, provide future projected growth estimates
• Plan, document and effectively implement projects and systems
Qualifications:
• 3+ years of customer-facing experience consulting on enterprise-class storage platforms
• 3+ years with Hitachi Vantara Block, Object and File storage and software platforms
• 1+ years performing capacity planning, performance analysis and development of data disaster
recovery plans
• Experience with applications and databases desirable
• Experience in operating systems administration across UNIX and Windows desirable
• Experience in virtual platform technology e.g. VMWare
• Experience with fabric, backup and compute administration is desirable
• Experience with Data Replication, Snap Shots and Virtualization Technology
• Knowledge of Networking, Routing and Switching Technologies and Windows Server Administration is
desirable
• Good knowledge of ITIL and working within a managed service framework
• Demonstrated ability to work in a high volume, fast paced environment with many deadlines and
competing priorities
• Willingness to manage a 24x7x365 storage, fabric, compute and backup environment including on-call
rotation, weekend work, etc
Competencies
• Demonstrate working proficiency in Hitachi Vantara storage and fabric management
• Able to communicate clearly with peers, as well as management, suppliers and Customer
• Self-driven and resourceful to achieve goals independently as well as work well in groups
• Flexibility to adjust to changing requirements, schedules and priorities
• The ability to socialise ideas, make recommendations and gather team consensus to move forward
• Excellent communication, writing, and meeting facilitation skills

 Championing diversity, equity, and inclusion 
Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are integral to our culture and identity. Diverse thinking, a commitment to allyship, and a culture of empowerment help us achieve powerful results. We want you to be you, with all the ideas, lived experience, and fresh perspective that brings. We support your uniqueness and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our team.
How we look after you
We want to help you take care of your today and tomorrow – at home and at work. Which is why we offer industry-leading benefits that go far beyond compensation. That means support, services, and resources that also take care of your holistic health and wellbeing. We’re always looking for new ways of working that bring out our best, which leads to unexpected ideas. Here, you’ll experience a sense of belonging, and discover autonomy, freedom, and ownership as you work alongside talented people you enjoy sharing knowledge with. We’re also champions of life balance and offer flexible arrangements that work for you (role and location dependent).
About us
We’re a global team of innovators. Together, we harness engineering excellence and passion for insight to co-create meaningful solutions to complex challenges. We turn organizations into data-driven leaders that can a make positive impact on their industries and society. If you believe that innovation can inspire the future, this is the place to fulfil your purpose and achieve your potential.
We’re proud to say we’re an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, age, disability status or any other protected characteristic. Should you need reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know so that we can do our best to set you up for success.

demographic_questions.description:
At Hitachi Vantara, we value the diversity of our workforce and strive to foster an inclusive environment in which talent from all backgrounds can thrive, bringing their unique contributions to our culture and success. We are an equal opportunity employer and seek to strengthen our hiring practices by identifying and mitigating the potential for bias in our assessment and selection processes.

Below is a set of voluntary demographic questions that, if you choose to complete, will provide aggregated data to inform our hiring strategy and help us uphold our commitment to inclusive hiring.  Your responses, or choice to not respond, will in no way be linked to your specific application and will not be used to inform the hiring decision.

Our company does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or veteran status. In order to track the effectiveness of our recruiting efforts and ensure we consider the needs of all our employees, please consider the following optional questions.
